snippet: In David Lang’s “love fail” he distills “Tristan” and makes it timeless — with music that is sparse, quiet and filled with silences.
abstract: New music composer David Lang discusses how his early experience with opera Tristan und Isolde has provided a foundation for his new work love fail, which will be presented by vocal quartet Anonymous 4 at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.
lead_paragraph: In David Lang’s “love fail” he distills “Tristan” and makes it timeless — with music that is sparse, quiet and filled with silences.
